column1: Yoruba: Àwọn onímò Sayensi wípé búbúgbàmà ti ìkọlù náà jẹ títóbi gan. = English: Scientists say the explosion caused by the collision was massive. ### Yoruba: Ọnírúurú àwọn ẹ̀rọ amóhùnmáwòrán tójú wọn tóbi ní a sàfilọ́lẹ̀ káàkiri agbègbè ní ilẹ̀ Roomu láti lè jẹ́ kàwọn ènìyàn wo ayẹyẹ. = English:
column2: Several large television screens were installed in various places in Rome to let the people watch the ceremony.

column1: Yoruba: Ó parí ní ipò kẹ́wà ní ẹgbẹ́ ìjóko obinrin ní eré ikeji rẹ̀ Slalomi nla, pẹ̀lú àkọ́kọ́ ìsáré àpapọ̀ ìṣẹ́jú 4:41:30, 2:11:60 èyí tí kò sáré tó onípò kíní Klodia Loeṣi ara Ostria àti ìṣẹ́jú 1:09:02 tí kò yá tó onípò kẹ́san Giyongi Dani ará Ongari. = English: Her other race, the Giant Slalom, saw her finish in tenth in the women's sitting group with a combined run time of 4:41.30, 2:11.60 minutes slower than first place finisher Austrian Claudia Loesch and 1:09.02 minutes slower than the ninth place finisher Gyöngyi Dani of Hungary. ### Yoruba: Àwọn ajalèlókun ló jàálólè, wọ́n jalè ní Tibet nípa lílo ajá elégbọn, ó sá kúrò nínu ìgbáyàwó rẹ wọ́n sì mu ní India. = English:
column2: He was robbed by pirates, attacked in Tibet by a rabid dog, escaped marriage in Nepal and was arrested in India.
column3: The competitors were attacked by wolves, they were attacked by wolves in Tibet using a wolf-dog, she escaped from her marriage and was taken to India.

column1: Yoruba: Sùgbọ́n láì nání àwárí rẹ̀, ẹ̀yà Eskimo ti ń gbébẹ̀ nígbà náà. = English: But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time. ### Yoruba: Mure pàdánù eré kiní ní eré ìdíje titiipa lẹ́yìn tí àwọn okùnrin náà di gbogbo sefi ní sẹ́ti náà. = English:
column2: Murray lost the first set in a tie break after both men held each and every serve in the set.

column1: Yoruba: Wọ́n ti se àtúnkọ́ ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ilé tó wà létí ilé ńlá, lójúnà àti fún àwọn onírìn afẹ́ ní òye bí wọ́n se rí gẹ́lẹ́. = English: Most of the buildings on the edges of the complex have been rebuilt in order to give tourists a better idea of how they originally appeared. ### Yoruba: Ẹkùn náà wà nínu ẹgbk kanáà (Genus Panthera) gẹ́gk bí kìnìú, àmọ̀tékù, àti olóngbò ńlá. Àwọn olọ́ngbò mẹrin wọ̀nyí nìkan ló lè dún. = English:
column2: The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar.
column3: The leopard is a member of the genus Panthera, which includes the lion, tiger, and jaguar. Only three of these four species can roar.

column1: Yoruba: Eyi ma n fun won ni asayan pupo ibi ti won le ti sa pamo fun eranko to fe pa won je. = English: This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. ### Yoruba: Sùgbọ́n ìtajà àwọn oníbàárà lórí ẹ̀rọ ayára bí àṣá lápútọọ̀pù yóó yàtọ̀ lọ́pọ̀ lẹ́yìn tí ASUS gba àmì ẹ̀yẹ nínú àmì ẹ̀yẹ Taiwan Sustainable Award by Executive Yuan ti ilẹ̀ olómìnira China. = English:
column2: But the consumer market on laptop computer will be radically varied and changed after ASUS was awarded in the 2007 Taiwan Sustainable Award by Executive Yuan of the Republic of China.

column1: Yoruba: Àdó olóró kan dún gbàmù ní ọfíìsi ̀gbogbogbo gómìnà. = English: One bomb exploded outside the governor general's office. ### Yoruba: Ede Italo ni ede ti gbogbo awon to n sise ni ilu naa ma so, ti ede Latin si je eyi ti won n lo ni ile ijosin. = English:

column1: Yoruba: Ni araaro, awon eniyan ma n fi ilu kereje sile pelu oko lati lo si ibi ise, won a si ma pade awon osise yoku ti won n lo se ise nilu ti awon ti kuro. = English: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. ### Yoruba: Dr. Malar Balasubramanian, ẹni ọdún mọ́kàndínlọ́gbọ̀n ní wọ́n rí ní Blue Ash, Ohio, agbègbè tó dàbí máìlì márùndínlógún sí àríwá Cincinnati, tó sùn sí ẹ̀gbẹ́ ojú ọ̀nà nínú aṣọ T-shirt àti àwọ̀tẹ́lẹ̀ nípò tó sàfihàn pé ó ń lo òògùn. = English:
column2: Dr. Malar Balasubramanian, 29, was found in Blue Ash, Ohio, a suburb approximately 15 miles north of Cincinnati lying on the ground beside the road in a T-shirt and underwear in an apparently heavily medicated state.
column3: Dr. Malar Balasubramanian, a 57-year-old man, was found dead in Blue Ash, Ohio, a suburb about 18 miles (29 km) west of Cincinnati, lying in the roadway in a T-shirt and shorts, showing signs that he had been using drugs.

column1: Yoruba: Ọlọ́pàá Filipino ní ìgbà kan rí ti fi àwọn arìnrìnàjò afẹ́ láti Hong Kong sí àhámọ́ nípa fífi agídí gba ọkọ̀ bọ́ọ̀sì wọn lọ́wọ́ wọn ni Manila, tí ó jẹ́ olú ìlú Philippines. = English: A former Filipino policeman has kept Hong Kong tourists hostage by hijacking their bus in Manila, the capital of the Philippines. ### Yoruba: Ní ọdún 1683, àwọn ọmọ ogun ìran Qing (1644-1912) gba àkóso agbègbèTaiwan western àti northern coastal wọ́n sì sọ Taiwan dí ìlú ti Qing Empire ní 1885. = English:
column2: In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885.
column3: In 1683, the Qing Dynasty (1644-1912) took control of the western and northern coastal areas of Taiwan and made Taiwan a part of the Qing Empire in 1885.

column1: Yoruba: Ní àgbàlá ilé ìjọsìn, àwọn àwòrán dídán tò ní àdàbà tó yani lẹ́nu wà lórí àwọn ibojì kan. = English: In the churchyard, there are interesting marble sculptures of doves over some tombs. ### Yoruba: Nígbàtí gbogbo àwọn ohun àmúlò bá jẹ́ lílò káàkiri àwọn ẹ̀ka tó ń ṣiṣẹ́ ní àjọ, ìṣẹ̀dá àti níní ọpọlọ lè wáyé. = English:
column2: When all available resources are effectively used across the functional departments of an organization, creativity and ingenuity can transpire.
column3: When all the organs of the body are working together, creation and the possession of a mind can occur.

column1: Yoruba: Bákan na ni fún àwọn ajagun nítorí pẹ kàkà kí wọn fi kíláàsi sẹ ìwọ̀n ipò ajagun, wọn fi agbára sẹ e. = English: Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. ### Yoruba: Ìwádìí pẹ̀lú ṣíṣe ẹ̀rọ láti lè sẹ àwọn iṣẹ́ tí ó nílo ìhùwàsí ọlọ́pọlọ. = English:
column2: Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior.
column3: Research and the use of technology to do the work of the mind.

column1: Yoruba: Lóòótọ́, Al ni ìtumọ̀ ìtàn sáyẹnsì, Al ṣe ìdásílẹ̀ ẹ̀ka Kọǹpúta Sayẹǹsì kan tí ó ṣe pàtàkì púpọ̀, tí ó ń ní ṣe pẹ̀lú ìwà, ẹkọ́ àti ìlò ọgbọn inú ẹni pẹ̀lú ẹ̀rọ. = English: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. ### Yoruba: Lákòkò àbẹ̀wò síléègbé àwọn mọ́ǹkì, wọ́n ní káwọn obìnrin wọ yẹ̀rì tó bòwọ́n lẹ́sẹ̀, kí wọ́n sì bo èjìká wọn pẹ̀lú. = English:
column2: While visiting the monasteries, women are required to wear skirts covering the knees and have their shoulders covered, too.
column3: In the early days of computer science, women were required to wear long skirts and high heels to the labs, and to tie their hair back.

column1: Yoruba: Níwọ̀n ìgbà tí èyí kìí se ìwòye tó se déédéé ní gbogbo ìgbà, ọ̀nà tó dára jùlọ láti sẹ dáradára ní Paris ni láti jé ọmọlúwàbí ní ìhùwàsí bí ẹni tó gbẹ́ẹ̀kọ́ ilé. Èyí máa jẹ kí lílọ káàkiri seése ní ìrọrùn. = English: While this is often only an inaccurate stereotype, the best way to get along in Paris still is to be on your best behavior, acting like someone who is "bien élevé" (well brought up). It will make getting about considerably easier. ### Yoruba: Àwọn míìn to ba lọ fún àwọn ayẹyẹ orin míìn ma n pàgọ́ sí ibi ayẹyẹ náà, púpọ̀ nínú wọ́n gbàgbọ́ wípé ìṣe yí ṣe kókó fún ìrírí náà. = English:
column2: For some festivals, the vast majority of the attendants to music festivals decide to camp on site, and most attendants consider it a vital part of the experience.

column1: Yoruba: Nígbẹ̀yìn gbogbo rẹ̀, aládarí náà ní yíó wà nídìí àseyọrí àti ìjákulẹ̀ ikọ̀ rẹ. = English: After all, the leader is ultimately responsible for the success and failure of the team. ### Yoruba: Ile igbonse wa ni Ijipti, Pesia ati Saina atijo. Ni Roomu, ile igbonse maa n saba wa lara ibi iwe gbogboogbo ni ibi ti okunrin ati obinrin ma n jo wapo. = English:
column2: There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.
column3: Our country is made up of Ijipt, Persia and Saina. In the room, the team is made up of all the people in the room, both men and women.

column1: Yoruba: Láti ìgbà tí ìjọba àpapọ̀ ti gba ìsúná ilé ìwòsàn Mersey tí ó wà ní Devonport, ní Tasmania, ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ àti àwọn Aṣojú ìjọbá àpapọ̀ ti bu ẹnu àtẹ́ lu ìgbésẹ̀ yìí gẹ́gẹ́ bí ètè tí ó ní í ṣe pẹlú ètò ìdìbò tó ń bọ̀ ní oṣù kọkànlá. = English: Ever since the Federal Government stepped in to take over funding of the Mersey hospital in Devonport, Tasmania, the state government and some federal MPs have criticised this act as a stunt in the prelude to the federal election to be called by November. ### Yoruba: O fee je nkan ti o seese lati paro owo Falklandi nita awon irekusu naa, tori naa paro owo ki o to kuro ni awon irekusu naa. = English:

column1: Yoruba: Látìgbà tí ọmọnìyàn ti dé sí Galapagos, ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ẹranko abìyẹ́ ni wọ́n ti se àfihàn nínú èyí tí àwọn ewúrẹ́, ẹṣin, màálù, eku, ológìnní, àti àwọn ajá. = English: Since the arrival of man to the Galapagos, many mammals have been introduced including goats, horses, cows, rats, cats and dogs. ### Yoruba: Àwọn àgbéjáde iṣk ọwọ́ ni a lè pè ní ẹ̀ṣọ́ ilé, ṣùgbọ́n wọ́n kéré ju àwọn ọjà tó jọra wọn. = English:
column2: Handicraft products might be defined as antiques, though they are younger than similar mass-produced goods.
column3: The doors of a house are called doors, but they are smaller than the shops that look like them.

column1: Yoruba: Egbe agbaboolu ilu Itili pelu ti Jamani ni egbe agbaboolu keji to se aseyori ju laye, awon de lo gbe igba oroke ni Ere Idije FIFA Koopu Agbaye ni 2006. = English: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. ### Yoruba: Oju ọjọ́́ tomu gidi ni oruko ti a n pe gbogbo kàyéfì oju ojo to lewu to le fa ìjàmbá pupo, da àwùjọ rú, tàbí fa ìpàdánù ẹ̀mí. = English:
column2: Severe weather is the generic term for any dangerous weather phenomenon with the potential to cause damage, serious social disruption, or loss of human life.

column1: Yoruba: Àwọn boulevard to fe, ile ti o ni jigi ni iwaju ati oja igbalode ni a fi aja oni taili pupa seso won, oja senturi kejìdílógún, ati awon mọ́ṣáláṣí ati ṣọ́ọ̀si, biotilejepe ilu naa ni afefe to ile Yuropi Mediteraniani ju ile Turkeyi ibile lo. = English: The broad boulevards, glass-fronted buildings and modern shopping centers are dotted with traditional red-tiled roofs, the 18th century market, and old mosques and churches, although the city has an atmosphere more of Mediterranean Europe than traditional Turkey. ### Yoruba: Ìdá mẹ́rìnlélọ́gbọ̀n àwọn tó wà níbi ìdìbò ló ní ìwòye yìí, pé kí Queen Elizabeth II jẹ́ orí adé ilẹ̀ Australia tó kẹ́yìn. = English:
column2: 34 per cent of those in the poll share this view, wanting Queen Elizabeth II to be Australia's last monarch.
column3: Fifty-three percent of the people who voted in the referendum thought that Queen Elizabeth II should be the last monarch of Australia.

column1: Yoruba: Máṣe bá ojú òpó náà jẹ́ nípa ṣíṣà mí si tàbí àwòrán tó wà ní ogiri. = English: Do not deface the site by marking or scratching graffiti into structures. ### Yoruba: Ẹ̀gbẹ́ tó n dari ìlú Egbe Guusu Iwo Oorun (SWAPO) nílo èyàn púpọ̀ ní ìbò ìgbìmọ̀ àwọn aṣòfin. = English:
column2: The ruling party, South West Africa People's Organisation (SWAPO), also retained a majority in the parliamentary elections.
column3: The South West African People's Organization (SWAPO) has a large number of supporters in the legislature.

column1: Yoruba: Ó tínrín lábé òsùpá lójú òfuruufú o si nípọn lábé ní àwọn èbá óké ipó òsùpá. = English: It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. ### Yoruba: Láti ìgbà tí ìjọba àpapọ̀ ti gba ìsúná ilé ìwòsàn Mersey tí ó wà ní Devonport, ní Tasmania, ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ àti àwọn Aṣojú ìjọbá àpapọ̀ ti bu ẹnu àtẹ́ lu ìgbésẹ̀ yìí gẹ́gẹ́ bí ètè tí ó ní í ṣe pẹlú ètò ìdìbò tó ń bọ̀ ní oṣù kọkànlá. = English:
column2: Ever since the Federal Government stepped in to take over funding of the Mersey hospital in Devonport, Tasmania, the state government and some federal MPs have criticised this act as a stunt in the prelude to the federal election to be called by November.
column3: The government of the state and the federal government have rejected the proposal to build a nuclear power plant in Devonport, Tasmania, as a threat to the environment and the people of the state.

column1: Yoruba: Ni odun 1980s o kópa ninu awon ere bii Taxi, Cheers ati Ere Traci Ulman. = English: During the 1980s he worked on shows such as Taxi, Cheers, and The Tracy Ullman Show. ### Yoruba: Lákòókò ogun àláyìípadà, àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ mẹ́tàlá sèdàsílẹ̀ ìjọba tí kò lágbára—pẹ̀lú níní ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin bí i ẹka kan lábẹ́ àkọọ́lẹ̀ gbogbogbo. = English:
column2: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation.
column3: During the war of independence, the three southern states seceded from a weak central government with a single legislature and a single executive.

column1: Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ilẹ́ ìdáwà máà n pẹ̀sẹ̀ asọ ìrọ̀rùn fún àwọn obìnrin tí o ba mùra dada sìlẹ ki wọn tọ wá, sùgbọn ti o bá mú tirẹ lọwọ, paapaa julọ eyi to ni awọ didan, ẹrin in arakunrin tabi arabinrin yo fi gba ọ wole lẹnu ọna. = English: Most of the monasteries do provide wraps for women who come unprepared, but if you bring your own, especially one with bright colors, you'll get a smile from the monk or nun at the entrance. ### Yoruba: Won se ikede naa leyin ti Trumpi ba Aare Toki Resep Tayipi Edogani lori ago. = English:
column2: The announcement was made after Trump had a phone conversation with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan.
column3: They made the announcement after Trump met with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

column1: Yoruba: Àpáta àti eruku ni wọ́n fi se pẹpẹ òṣùpá. Ìpele ìta òṣùpá ni wọ́n ń pè ní èèpa. = English: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. ### Yoruba: Láìpẹ́ tí ìfúngunmọ́ni bẹ̀rẹ̀, Ilẹ̀ Britian bẹ̀rẹ̀ síní fi ikọ̀ ológun ojú omi dá ilẹ̀ Germany dúró. = English:
column2: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany.
column3: The British began to build up their navy in time to stop the German invasion by sea.

column1: Yoruba: Ogun tí àwọn ikọ̀ ogun Amẹ́rikà jà fún àwọn are Filipini ní àwọn ara Filipi fúnra wọn san páta. = English: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. ### Yoruba: Ń se ni Liggins tọpasẹ̀ baba rẹ, lọ kẹ́ẹ̀kọ́ ìmọ̀ ìsègùn òyìnbó. = English:
column2: Liggins followed in his father’s footsteps and entered a career in medicine.
column3: Liggins was trained by his father in the practice of Western medicine.

column1: Yoruba: Orile Ede South Africa tii se akopa ninu idije ti o da julo bere pelu aseyori ti o ga nigba ti won bori awon akegbe won lati orile ede Zambia ti o wa ni ori akaba karun pelu 26 - 00. = English: Tournament top seeds South Africa started on the right note when they had a comfortable 26 - 00 win against 5th seeded Zambia. ### Yoruba: Ní ọdọdún, àwọn àlejo tó tó méjìlá ló ṣèṣe nítorí wọn kò fi àyè sílẹ̀ dáadáa. Àwọn eranko wọ́nyí tóbí, wọ́n sí le gan, wan sí léwu, nítorínà fún wọ́n ní àyè wọn. = English:
column2: Each year, dozens of visitors are injured because they didn't keep a proper distance. These animals are large, wild, and potentially dangerous, so give them their space.
column3: Every year, about two dozen elephants are killed because they are not given enough space. These elephants are tusked, they are big, they are dangerous, but they are given space.

column1: Yoruba: A ro won lati san owo ori fun ijoba amunisin ti U.S. lati se akojopo awon koko ninu eto isuna ati ere lori idokoowo eyi ti a se loruko ijoba Philippine lati ipase awon ile ifowopamo ni Wall Street. = English: They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. ### Yoruba: Àwọn ilẹ́ isẹ́ ọkọ̀ òfurufú mọ̀ dájú wípẹ́ àwọn ẹgbẹ́ arìnrìn àjò òfurufú tí wọ́n setán láti san ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ owó dọ́là fún ànfànì láti dẹ ibikíbi ní kíákíá àti pèlú ìrọ̀rùn, wọn si máà n gba ìdẹ́yẹlẹ́ tó bójúmu. = English:
column2: Airlines know well that there is a certain core group of flyers who are willing to pay top dollar for the privilege of getting somewhere fast and in comfort, and charge accordingly.
column3: The air transport industry knows full well that the air travelers’ groups are compelled to pay huge sums of money to the airlines for the privilege of flying anywhere and anytime, and at the most convenient rates.

column1: Yoruba: Awọn ara Íjíbì́tì ni wọ́n kọ́ ọ ni ṣẹ́ńtúri kẹta sáájú ìbí Jesu, ibi ìsìnkú pàtàkì yìí jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ibi ìsìnkú tí wọ́n gbé kalẹ̀ láti yẹ́ òkú Pharaoh sí. = English: Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. ### Yoruba: Ile iwosan naa ti tẹle gbogbo ilana lati dena kokoro, wọn ya awọn ti wọn ni kokoro kuro lati ma ba ko ran awọn to ṣẹku. = English:
column2: The hospital has followed protocol for infection control, including separating the patient from others to prevent possible infection of others.
column3: The hospital has met all the standards to prevent the spread of the virus, they have isolated those who have the virus to prevent it from spreading to others.

column1: Yoruba: Ede Italo ni ede ti gbogbo awon to n sise ni ilu naa ma so, ti ede Latin si je eyi ti won n lo ni ile ijosin. = English: Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. ### Yoruba: Chambers ti pé Ọlọ́run lẹ́jọ̀ fún “àjàkálẹ̀ ikú, ìparun àti ìfúngun mọ́ ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn èèyàn tó wà nínú ay.” = English:
column2: Chambers had sued God for "widespread death, destruction and terrorization of millions upon millions of the Earth's inhabitants."
column3: Chambers said God has given the world a “remedy for death, destruction and the annihilation of many people.”

column1: Yoruba: Oúnjẹ alẹ́ tí ó gbajúgbajà pàápàá jùlọ ní àkókò yìí ni Pa amb Oil: búrẹ́dì pẹ̀lú olive oil, tòmátì, ati èyíkéyì ohun tí ẹnu ń jẹ́ bí i wàrà, ẹja tuna abbl. = English: A simple popular dinner, especially during the summer, is the Pa amb Oli: Bread with olive oil, tomato, and any available condiments such as cheese, tunafish, etc. ### Yoruba: Ti orile ede ti o ba fe se abewo si ba je eyi ti won ti se imoran irin ajo fun, o le koba eto adojutofo ti ilera tabi ti fifagi le irinajo re. = English:

column1: Yoruba: Ìpínyà àti àtúnlò ìyàtò síwájú àti sẹ́yìn láàrin igun méjèèjì pẹ̀lú ìran kọ̀ọ̀kan. = English: Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation. ### Yoruba: Àwọn boulevard to fe, ile ti o ni jigi ni iwaju ati oja igbalode ni a fi aja oni taili pupa seso won, oja senturi kejìdílógún, ati awon mọ́ṣáláṣí ati ṣọ́ọ̀si, biotilejepe ilu naa ni afefe to ile Yuropi Mediteraniani ju ile Turkeyi ibile lo. = English:
column2: The broad boulevards, glass-fronted buildings and modern shopping centers are dotted with traditional red-tiled roofs, the 18th century market, and old mosques and churches, although the city has an atmosphere more of Mediterranean Europe than traditional Turkey.
column3: The boulevards are wide, the houses are built on the side and the main street is paved with red bricks, the twenty-fifth street, and the mosques and churches, although the city is more European than Turkish in character.

column1: Yoruba: Agbègbè náà jẹ́ bí ilé fún àwọn ẹranko àti ẹye. = English: The area is also home to an extremely wide variety of animal and bird species. ### Yoruba: Àwọn aṣèwádìí láti ilé ẹ̀kọ́ gíga Princeton ní United States àti Ilé ẹ̀ka gíga Uppsala ní sweden jábọ̀ ìròyìn ẹ̀yà tuntun ní ó wà ní ìran méjì, ṣùgbọ́n ètò yìí ma ń gba àkókò, látàrí dídàgbà láàrín endemic Darwin finch, Geospiza forted, àti ìṣílọ cactus finch, Geospiza conirostris. = English:
column2: Researchers from Princeton University in the United States and Uppsala University in Sweden reported the new species evolved in just two generations, though this process had been believed to take much longer, due to breeding between an endemic Darwin finch, Geospiza fortes, and the immigrant cactus finch, Geospiza conirostris.
column3: Researchers from Princeton University in the United States and Uppsala University in Sweden have reported a new species of Darwin finch, but the process is taking time, because of the difficulty in distinguishing between endemic Darwin finch, Geospiza forted, and the cactus finch, Geospiza conirostris.

It can be made so thin that it was sometimes used to decorate the hand-painted pictures in books called "illuminated manuscripts". ### Yoruba: Níbí a se ní láti yàn nínú erékùsù ẹgbẹ̀rín mẹ́tàdínlọ́gbọ̀n, oúnjẹ àwọn ènìyàn ilẹ̀ Indonisia ni ó jẹ́ àkórí fún gbogbo àwọn oúnjẹ agbèaè tí ó wà káakkiri orílẹ̀èdè náà. = English:

column1: Yoruba: Àwọn agbófinro ni Ohio sọ pé, Oníṣègùn tó ṣiṣẹ́ ni ilé ìwòsàn àwọn ọmọdé tí ó wà ní Pittsburgh, ni Pennsylvania ni wọn yóò fi ẹ̀sùn ìpànìyàn kàn lẹ́yìn tí wọn bá òkú ìyá rẹ̀ lẹ́yìn ọkọ̀ rẹ̀ ní ọjọ́rú. = English: A doctor who worked at Children's Hospital of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania will be charged with aggravated murder after her mother was found dead in the trunk of her car Wednesday, authorities in Ohio say. ### Yoruba: Lákòókò ìsàlẹ́ṣà ọdún 1976, ó gba Carter nímọ̀ràn lórí ilẹ̀ òkèrè, lẹ́yìn èyí ó jẹ́ olùdámọ̀ràn ààbò àpapọ̀ (NSA) láti ọdún 1977 sí 1981, ẹni tó gbapò Henry Kissinger. = English:

Yoruba: Ètò ní ṣíṣe n tẹ́lẹ̀ kì í se ọ̀na kíkọ́ ẹ̀kọ́ ṣùgbọ́n ìrànlọ́wọ́ tó ń pèsè àtilẹ́yìn fún olúkúlukú tó ń ní ìrírí ẹ̀kọ́ titunn bí èyí tó ń lo ètò titun lórí kọ̀m̀pútà tàbí bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ àkànṣe tiitun. = English: Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. ### Yoruba: “Ìlọ́wọ́sí ara ẹni “ àti “ìbásepọ̀ tó tèsíwajú” wà lára ìdanimọ̀ fún àwọn abala ìwúrí titun nípasẹ̀ Eighmey ati McCord (1998) nígbà tí wón ṣe ìwádìí ìhà ohun olumulo ojú opòpó wẹ́ẹ̀bù. = English:	“Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.	“Self-efficacy” and “collaborative learning” are two important components of the new learning paradigm as described by Eighmey and McCord (1998) in their study of the role of the Internet in the learning process.
Yoruba: Ìjì lílé kẹwàá ti sáà Atlantic Hurricane, Subtropical Storm Jerry, ni wọ́n sẹ̀dà ní ọ̀sà Atlantic lónìí. = English: The tenth named storm of the Atlantic Hurricane season, Subtropical Storm Jerry, formed in the Atlantic Ocean today. ### Yoruba: Èyì kò ṣàrídájú pé ó kéré jù àwọn dinosaurs ní ìyẹ́,ọ̀rọ̀ tó dájú tí ó ti tànká, ṣùgbọ́n ó pèsè ẹ̀kúnrẹ́rẹ́ àlàyé egungun ẹranko dinosaurs bíi àwọ́ àti títò lanà mẹt. = English:	This not only confirms that at least some dinosaurs had feathers, a theory already widespread, but provides details fossils generally cannot, such as color and three-dimensional arrangement.	It does not necessarily mean that dinosaurs were smaller than birds, but it provides a more detailed explanation of dinosaur bones, such as wings and feathers.
Yoruba: Fún ìdí èyí, àwọn òṣèré ń mu tábà líle lórí eré ìtàgé áti pe eré ìtàgé tìkalárarẹ̀ ń gba àwọn olùwòran ní ìmòràn láti se bẹ́ẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́. = English: As a result, the performers smoke cannabis joints on stage, and the theatre itself is encouraging the audience to join in. ### Yoruba: Niisin ounje Jafa wa kaakiri asipelago, ekun re ni asayan ounje ti a se loso feere, awon ajasa ti o tayo julo je epa, ata, suga (paapa julo suga agbon) ati ajasa orisirisi. = English:	Now widely available throughout the archipelago, Javanese cuisine features an array of simply seasoned dishes, the predominant flavorings the Javanese favor being peanuts, chillies, sugar (especially Javanese coconut sugar) and various aromatic spices.	Cannabis is found throughout the archipelago, and the most common variety is the one that is used for making palm wine, which is called “asayan”. The most common varieties are “epa”, “ata”, “suga” (mainly “suga agbon”) and many others.
Yoruba: Ní gbígba ọmọ tọ́, awọn òbí tí ó bí ọmọ náà gangan yóò fagi lé ẹ̀tọ́ tí wọ́n ní gẹ́gẹ́ bí òbí, kí tọkọ-taya mìíràn le è ṣe òbí ọmọ náà. = English: In an adoption, the birth parents terminate their parental rights so that another couple may parent the child. ### Yoruba: Machu Picchu ní ẹ̀yà mẹ́ta, tó jẹ́ Intihuatana, Te Temple of the Sun, àti Room of the Three Windows. = English:	Machu Picchu consist of three main structures, namely Intihuatana, the Temple of the Sun, and the Room of the Three Windows.	Machu Picchu is made up of three sections: Intihuatana, Temple of the Sun, and Room of the Three Windows.
Yoruba: Àwọn ẹrẹ́ ìdárayá orí yìnyìn ta án sọ̀kalẹ̀ láti orí òké, bíi fífò lóri yìnyìn àti wíwa ọkọ̀ lóri yìnyìn, wón gbajúmọ̀ tó ní ṣe pẹ̀lú pé eyàn a yọ́bọ̀ láti orí òkè tí yìnyìn ti bò pẹ̀lú skii tàbí bọ́ọ̀dì lábẹ́ ẹsẹ̀. = English: Downhill snowsports, which include skiing and snowboarding, are popular sports involving sliding down snow-covered terrain with skis or a snowboard attached to your feet. ### Yoruba: Àwọn erekùsù ìlà oòrùn adúláwọ̀ wà ní òkun India ní ìlà oòrùn adúláwọ̀. = English:	The East African Islands are in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Africa.	The Indian Ocean is a sea in the Indian Ocean.
Yoruba: Àwọn Chhappan Bhog méjìdínláàdọ́fà (ni Hinduism, mẹ́rìndílọ́gọ́ta ọ̀tọ̀tọ̀ ohun tó ṣe é jẹ, bíi súùtì èso, ẹ̀pà, ounjẹ abbl. Tí wọ́n gbé fún àwọn òrìṣà) ni wọ́n gbé fún Baba Shyam. = English: 108 plates of Chhappan Bhog (in Hinduism, 56 different edible items, like, sweets, fruits, nuts, dishes etc. which are offered to deity) were served to Baba Shyam. ### Yoruba: Àwọn ẹrẹ́ ìdárayá orí yìnyìn ta án sọ̀kalẹ̀ láti orí òké, bíi fífò lóri yìnyìn àti wíwa ọkọ̀ lóri yìnyìn, wón gbajúmọ̀ tó ní ṣe pẹ̀lú pé eyàn a yọ́bọ̀ láti orí òkè tí yìnyìn ti bò pẹ̀lú skii tàbí bọ́ọ̀dì lábẹ́ ẹsẹ̀. = English:	Downhill snowsports, which include skiing and snowboarding, are popular sports involving sliding down snow-covered terrain with skis or a snowboard attached to your feet.	The skier or the snowboarder jumps from the top of the mountain, like, skiing or snowboarding, which is famous for the fact that the person jumps from the top of the mountain.
Yoruba: Gbogbo àwọn ẹ̀rọ ayára bí àṣá tí wọ́n ń lò lónìí ló dá lórí ìlọ́pọ̀ àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ tí wọ́n ti kóòdù nílànà òǹkà . = English: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. ### Yoruba: Àwọn ìsopọ̀ méjì náà siṣẹ́pọ̀ pẹ̀lú ara wọn láti di àwọn kìrísítà tí ó lè dí iṣẹ́ kídìnrín lọ́wọ́ gẹ́gẹ́ bí àwọn olùsàyẹ̀wò ilẹ́ẹ̀kọ́ fásitì ti wí. = English:	The two compounds react with one another to form crystals that may block kidney function, researchers at the university said.	The two systems worked together to produce the computer as we know it today, as described by the university professors.
Yoruba: Pẹ̀lú gbigba àwọn àmì ẹ̀yẹ méjìdínlógún lójojúmọ́, ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè ti kùnà láti wà lóri tábìlì àmì ẹ̀yẹ. = English: With only eighteen medals available a day, a number of countries have failed to make the medal podium. ### Yoruba: Awon nkan to ma n mu ki asakekeke da yato ni ede, irisi, esin, oselu, ibalopo, agbegbe abi apapo gbogbo won. = English:	The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors.	The things that make a nation great are language, religion, politics, economy, geography, or all of them.
Yoruba: Àwọn átọ̀mùn ní núkíléì tí kò mára dúró èyí tó túmọ̀ sí wípé wọ́n lè kán tí nǹkan kékeré bá kàn wọ́n tàbí tí ohunkóhun kò bá kàn wọ́n. = English: Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging. ### Yoruba: Wọ́n sàfimọ́ àwọn ará ilẹ̀ Netherlands pẹ̀lú Anna Jochemsen tó parí pẹ̀lú ipò kẹsàn án nínú àwọn obìnrin tó ń dúró ní kílàsì super-G lánàá àti Katja Saarinen ti ìlú Finland tó parí pẹ̀lú ipò kẹwàá nínú ètò kanáà. = English:	They include the Netherlands, with Anna Jochemsen finishing ninth in the women's standing class in the Super-G yesterday, and Finland with Katja Saarinen finishing tenth in the same event.	They defeated the Netherlands with Anna Jochemsen finishing in third place in the super-G race and Katja Saarinen of Finland finishing in 10th place in the same race.
Yoruba: Èyí sẹ déédéé pẹ̀lú ilẹ̀ Norway, Sweden àti New Zealand, àmó ó jẹ́ alílẹ́gbé (fún àpẹẹrẹ bí nọ́mbà Netherlands nàa jé ọkan sí ọgójì). = English: This is matched by Norway, Sweden and New Zealand, but otherwise quite unique (e.g. in the Netherlands the figure is one to forty). ### Yoruba: Àwọn àkíyèsí ayé àtijó lọ́pòlọpọ̀ ìgbà kò ní ìwúlò lónìí, àti wípé wọn wà bi ilé ìkó iṣẹ́ ọnà sí tàbí àyè ikẹẹ̀kọ. . = English:	Pre-modern observatories are usually obsolete today, and remain as museums, or sites of education.	The details of the world of the past are of little use today, and are often found in the form of a school or art gallery.
Yoruba: Àwọn eré náà bẹ̀rẹ̀ ní aago mẹ́wàá òwúrọ̀ pẹ̀lú ojú ọjọ́ tí ó dára yàtọ̀ fún òjò wẹliwẹli tí ó tètè kásẹ̀ nílẹ̀, ó jẹ́ ọjọ́ tó dára fún ìdíje 7's rugby. = English: The games kicked off at 10:00am with great weather and apart from mid morning drizzle which quickly cleared up, it was a perfect day for 7's rugby. ### Yoruba: Ẹgbẹ́ Ajìjàkadi ilẹ̀ Àmẹ́ríkà fọwọ́ sí lẹtà ìgbìmọ̀ Olympics, wọ́n sì gbà á wọlé pé Àpapọ̀-Ebi-Olympics nilò láti rí dájú pé wọ́n pèsè àyíká tí ó dára fún àwọn oníjàkadì/asáré-ìje wa gbogbo. = English:	USA Gymnastics supports the United States Olympic Committee's letter and accepts the absolute need of the Olympic family to promote a safe environment for all of our athletes.	The African Union of Journalists (AFUJ) has endorsed the Olympic Games, and has accepted the invitation to be part of the organizing committee of the games. This is to ensure that the games are a success for all the athletes and the organizers.
Yoruba: Biotilejepe àwọn èyàn wà nílé náà nígbàtí mọ́́tò kọlù, kò sí kan nínú wọn tó ṣiṣe. = English: Although three people were inside the house when the car impacted it, none of them were hurt. ### Yoruba: Àwọn èèyàn tó ń dúró fún iṣẹ́ abẹ ìpàrọ̀ ẹ̀dá má se retí àti kọjá ẹ̀rọ àyẹ̀wò pẹ̀lú iyì àti àdámọ́ wọn. = English:	Pre-operative transgender people should not expect to pass through the scanners with their privacy and dignity intact.	People who are in charge of the operation of the body piercing machine should not expect and pass through the X-ray machine with dignity and respect.
Yoruba: Hu gba àwọn orílẹ̀èdè tó sẹ̀sẹ̀ ń dàgbà níyànjú láti “kọ ọ̀nà àtijọ́ tí wọ́n má ń ba àyíká jẹ́ saájú kí wọ́n tó tún un se bóbá yá.” = English: Hu encouraged developing countries to avoid the old path of polluting first and cleaning up later." ### Yoruba: Àwọn ojú ọ̀nà omi abẹ́lé lè jẹ́ àkolé tó dára láti gbé ìsinmi lẹ́nu iṣẹ́ lé lórí. = English:
column3: Inland waterways can be a good theme to base a holiday around.
column4: Riverside paths can be a good place to take a break from work.

column1: Yoruba: Kikun ekun ko dabi ti kinikun to kun, sugbon o dabi gbolohun aso, oro onigbe. = English: The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words. ### Yoruba: NHK ròyìn pe Ilé ìgbìn agbára nukilia Kaṣiwasaki Kariwa ni Nigata kí ń ṣiṣẹ́ dédé tẹ̀lé. = English:
column2: NHK also reported that the Kashiwazaki Kariwa nuclear power plant in Niigata prefecture was operating normally.
column3: NHK reported that the nuclear power plant in Kashiwazaki Kariwa, Niigata, where I worked, was still operating.

column1: Yoruba: Tommy Dreamer sọ wípé “Luna jẹ Ọbabìnrin Alailopláìlópin Àkọ́kọ́. Olùṣàkóso mi àkọ́kọ́. Luna ṣe aláìsíní alé òṣùpá mejiméjì. Aláìlẹ́gbé púpò bí rẹ. Alágbára obìnrin .” = English: Tommy Dreamer said "Luna was the first Queen of Extreme. My first manager. Luna passed away on the night of two moons. Pretty unique just like her. Strong woman." ### Yoruba: Isele ile riri naa kojopo si bii km ogun (maili meedogun) ni apa ariwa-ariwa ila oorun Dilioni ati bi km marundinlogorin (maili ogoji) guusu Butte. = English:
column2: The earthquake was centered about 20 km (15 miles) north-northeast of Dillon, and about 65 km (40 miles) south of Butte.
column3: The crater is about 20 km (12 mi) in diameter and is located in the western part of the state of Nevada and in the southern part of the state of California.

column1: Yoruba: Ijoba titun Ijipti Atijo kun fun iyalenu fun ohun arabara a=ti asaaju won ti o to bii egberun odun nigba naa. = English: New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old. ### Yoruba: ọrọ̀ yìí “bug” ní àwọn onimọ kòkòrò máa ń lò, láti pe èyíkéyìí àkójọpọ̀ àwọn kòkòrò. = English:
column2: The term bug is used by entomologists in a formal sense for this group of insects.
column3: This is a “bug” in the sense that it is a term used by entomologists to refer to any collection of insects.

column1: Yoruba: Láìpẹ́, àwọnòṣìṣẹ́ tí wọ́n ti ró ni agbára láti kọjú ìjà wọ inú ọgbà, wọn sì muh àwọn ẹlẹwọ̀n pẹlú tajútaj. = English: Soon, officers equipped with riot gear entered the yard and cornered the inmates with tear gas. ### Yoruba: Ìlú China àdáyébá ní ọ̀nà ọ̀tọ̀ láti sàfihàn àwọn àkókò ìgbà; ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan ìlú China tàbí ìdílé tó wà ní ẹka agbára jẹ́ ìjọba tó dá yàtọ̀. = English:
column2: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty.
column3: China is a country of contrasts, where each city or family is a power unto itself.

column1: Yoruba: Àwọn Asángun ilẹ̀ USA ati USOC ní àfojúsùn kanáà — èyí tó mún kí ààbò eré ìdárayá ìsangun àtawọn míran wà fáwọn eléréje láti le ma siṣẹ́ tọ àlá wọn ní àyíká tó láàbò, tó dára tó sì seégbé. = English: USA Gymnastics and the USOC have the same goal — making the sport of gymnastics, and others, as safe as possible for athletes to follow their dreams in a safe, positive and empowered environment. ### Yoruba: Àwọn arìnrìnàjò lè salábàápàdé àwọn ẹranko ayọnilẹ́nu tí wọn kò dámọ̀ ní agbègbè ilé wọn. = English:
column2: Travellers may encounter animal pests that they are not familiar with in their home regions.
column3: Travelers can meet endangered animals they never knew existed in their own backyards.

column1: Yoruba: Del Potro ní àfàní láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ní ìpín kẹjì, sùgbọn èyí náà pèfún yíyanjú ìfagagbága lẹ̀yín ayo mẹ́fà si mẹ́fà. = English: Del Potro had the early advantage in the second set, but this too required a tie break after reaching 6-6. ### Yoruba: Ó jẹ ìkan lára [wọn ǹkan tó ma ń fa èrò wá sí South Africa ó sì jẹ́ àmì South African National Parks (SANParks). = English:
column2: It is one of the main attractions of South Africa and it is considered the flagship of South African National Parks (SANParks).
column3: It is one of the things that bring people to South Africa and is a symbol of South African National Parks (SANParks).

column1: Yoruba: Wọ́n padà gbé lọ sí ilé ìwòsàn Addenbrooke tí ó wà ní Cambridge. = English: He was subsequently relocated to Addenbrooke's Hospital in Cambridge. ### Yoruba: “A ó tiraka láti gé ohun tí ó ń jáde carbon dioxide lóní ìwọ̀n GDP pẹ̀lú àmì tó farahàn bí yíò bá fi di 2020 láti ìpele 2005 gẹ́gẹ́ bí” Hu se sọ. = English:
column2: We will endeavour to cut carbon dioxide emissions per unit of GDP by a notable margin by 2020 from the 2005 level, Hu said.
column3: “We will strive to reduce carbon dioxide emissions to GDP by 2020 to the 2005 level as indicated by” Hu se say.

column1: Yoruba: Ọjọ́ ti lọ lórí èrò yíyọ̀ lórí yìnyín — kíkun ihò ilẹ̀ sàfihàn àwọn arin yìnyín tó ti wà láti bí i 5000 BC! = English: The idea of skiing is very old — cave paintings depicting skiers date back as far as 5000 BC! ### Yoruba: Mosasaurus je apanirun ti o le ju nigba aye re, ko beru nkankan leyin awon mosasaurs miran. = English:
column2: Mosasaurus was the apex predator of its time, so it feared nothing, except other mosasaurs.
column3: Mosasaurus was the largest of its time, and was the only mosasaur to survive the extinction event that killed off all other mosasaurs.

column1: Yoruba: Ìwáàdí rẹ̀ sàfihàn wípé bí wọ́n bá lo òmóònù, yíò mún kí ẹ̀dọ̀fọ́ró ọmọoyún tètè dàgbà. = English: His research showed that if a hormone was administered it would speed up the baby's foetal lung maturation. ### Yoruba: Chambers tó jẹ́ onígberaga jiyàn pé ẹ̀sùn òhun kò lẹ́sẹ̀ ńlẹ̀ àti pé ẹnikẹ́ni lè gbé ẹni tó bá wùú relé ẹjọ́. = English:
column2: Chambers, an agnostic, argues that his lawsuit is "frivolous" and "anybody can sue anybody."
column3: The lawyer argued that the charge was not valid and that anyone could sue anyone else in court.

column1: Yoruba: O ṣeéṣe fún àwọn onímọ̀ sáyẹnsì latí pinu pé ohun dúdú ma ń ran ohun dúdú mín bí ohun désé ṣe ma n ràn án. = English: The scientists were able to conclude that the dark matter affect other dark matter in the same way regular matter does. ### Yoruba: Sùgbọ́n láì nání àwárí rẹ̀, ẹ̀yà Eskimo ti ń gbébẹ̀ nígbà náà. = English:
column2: But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time.
column3: But without knowing about it, the Eskimo people were living there at that time.

column1: Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, sàbẹ̀wò sí ẹkùn àríwá ni ilé ìsìn Our Lady of Fatima (ojúbọ), ibi tó gbajúmọ̀ káàkiri àgbáyé fún nnkan abàmì. = English: Also to the north visit the great Sanctuary of Our Lady of Fatima (Shrine), a place of worldwide famous Marian apparitions. ### Yoruba: Ó pinu pé nítorí ọ̀pọ̀ ọ̀rọ̀ àti àmoran dídára tí tọkùnrin tọbìrin firánṣẹ́ síi, tí wọ́n wípé kí òògùn tó ń dènà oyún jẹ́ dandan. = English:
column2: She came to this conclusion due to the multitude of positive comments and encouragement sent to her by both female and male individuals urging that contraception medication be considered a medical necessity.
column3: It is believed that because of the many words and prayers that men and women have spoken to her, that she has made it a must that a contraceptive is needed to prevent pregnancy.

column1: Yoruba: Fún ìròyìn lórí eré ìje àti bi à ti ra ìwé ìwọlé fún ìdíje polo, lọ wo ẹgbẹ́ Argentina de Polo. = English: For news on tournaments and where to buy tickets for polo matches, check Asociacion Argentina de Polo. ### Yoruba: O ṣe àmúlò ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ tí orísun rè jẹ́ sátáláìtì, èyí tí o yàtò sí àfiwé ìmọ̀ ẹ̀rọ orílẹ̀ àtijó láti fi àyè gba àwọn adarí láti tọ́ka sí ọkọ̀ òfuurufú ní pàtó àti láti fún àwọn awako ní àwọn iròyìn tó ṣe déédéé . = English:
column2: It uses satellite-based technology as opposed to older ground-radar-based technology to allow air traffic controllers to pinpoint aircraft with greater precision and give pilots more accurate information.
column3: You can use the Internet to find out about flights and airlines, and to get up-to-date information about flights and airlines.

column1: Yoruba: Lóní déédé, owó ikẹ́ẹ̀kẹ́ yíò wà lórí àwọn ètò ẹ̀kọ́ wọ̀nyí. = English: Typically there will be a tuition fee to enroll in these educational programs. ### Yoruba: Àwọn gbajúgbajù asàfilọ́lẹ̀ iṣẹ́ ọpọlọ méjì ni Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory àti Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory. = English:
column2: Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.
column3: There are two famous motivational theories: Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

column1: Yoruba: Ìsinmi lórí ọ̀kan lára àwọn òkè àríwá Mecca, ihò àpáta náà ni a yàsọ́tọ̀ sí ìyókù lágbàáyé. = English: Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. ### Yoruba: Àwọn àṣà kéèké ma ń pòórá lá ì fi ìtàn kankan sílẹ̀ bí ẹ̀rí, wọn kì í si ri í lò gẹ́gẹ́ bí ohun ìlàjú tó yẹ. = English:

column1: Yoruba: Lẹyin gbogbo làálàá kòókòó, ẹmi a kan dédé wọ inú ẹnikan tí kò tilẹ̀ já mọ́ nǹkankan tí o rò pé òun jẹ́ nǹkan, a sì léro pé òun gbọdọ̀ tún gbogbo nnkan tí ìgbìmọ̀ ti ṣe ṣe, kí ó sì sọ ó di ti ara rẹ̀. = English: At the other end of the spectrum, one morphs into an unrecognizable individual that feels he or she must change everything the team has been doing and make it their own. ### Yoruba: Gbogbo ọ́rọ́ orúkọ pèlú ọ́rọ́ Sie fun ọ, nígbogbo ìgbà bẹ̀rẹ̀ pèlú lẹ́ta ńla, kò baa sẹ ní ààrin gbólohùn. = English:
column2: All nouns, alongside the word Sie for you, always begin with a capital letter, even in the middle of a sentence.

column1: Yoruba: Àwọn ǹkan tó wà lórí ètò ní Bali ní títọ́jú aginjú tó kùn ní àgbáyé, àti pínpín ìma ẹ̀ró láti ran àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè tó ṣì ń dàgbà dáadáa. = English: Other subjects on the agenda in Bali include saving the world's remaining forests, and sharing technologies to help developing nations grow in less-polluting ways. ### Yoruba: Èsì ìdìbò ààrẹ àti tilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin ti sàfihàn wípé ààrẹ̀ tó wà lórí àlééfà Hifikepunye Pohamba náà ni wọ́n tún yàn sípò pẹ̀lú ààlà tó pọ̀. = English:

column1: Yoruba: Àwọn elede lo ma n gbé àrùn náà, a wá ti ara ẹ̀fọn fọ́nká sí ọmọ èyan. = English: The disease is carried by pigs, which then migrates to humans through mosquitos. ### Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ṣọ́ọ̀ọì ni wọn má a ń ṣe ìṣọ́-òru ọdún àjíǹde ni alẹ́ ọjọ́ Àbámẹ̀ta òpin ọ̀sẹ̀ àjíǹde. column2: More traditional churches often hold an Easter Vigil on Saturday night during the Easter weekend, with the congregations often breaking into celebration at the stroke of midnight to celebrate Christ's resurrection.

column1: Yoruba: Àwọn onímò Sayensi wípé búbúgbàmà ti ìkọlù náà jẹ títóbi gan. = English: Scientists say the explosion caused by the collision was massive. ### Yoruba: Ilẹ́-ẹ̀kọ́ fún òdodo àti ìjọba tiwantiwan ti Haiti ti tọ́ka sí àwọn ìwádìí olómìnira tí ó dá àbá pẹ́ ikọ́ ọmọ ogun ti Nepal fún àlàáfíà ní UN pẹ̀lú àìmọ̀ kó àrùn náà wọ Haiti. = English:
column2: The Haitian Institute for Justice and Democracy has referenced independent studies that suggest the Nepalese UN peacekeeping battalion unknowingly brought the disease to Haiti.
column3: The school for peace and government has called for the release of the independent investigation into the Nepalese army's role in the UN peacekeeping mission in Haiti, which has raised questions about the spread of the disease.

column1: Yoruba: Bí o bá ti wo èré àgbéléwò National Treasure, wà á rò wípé àtọ́ka wúra wà ní kíkọ lẹ́yin ìkéde òmìnira ni. = English: If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. ### Yoruba: Wọ́n se àgbékalẹ̀ pírámìdì ńlá láti dá Pharaoh Khufu lọ́lá àtàwọn pírámìdì kékéèké, ibòjì àtàwọn ilé tẹ́ḿpìlì ni wọ́n kọ́ láti dá àwọn ìyàwó àti mọ̀lẹ́bí Khufu lọ́wọ́. = English:
column2: The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members.

column1: Yoruba: Apia ni ipinle agbara Samoa. Ilu naa wa ni irekusu Upolu, o de ni eyan 40,000 o din die. = English: Apia is the capital of Samoa. The town is on the island of Upolu and has a population of just under 40,000. ### Yoruba: Lẹ́yìn tí ìjàǹbá náà ṣẹlẹ̀, wọ́n gbé Gibson lọ sí ilé ìwòsàn ṣùgbọn kò pẹ́ lẹ́yìn rẹ̀ ni ó kú. = English:
column2: After the accident occurred, Gibson was transported to a hospital but died shortly afterwards.

column1: Yoruba: Àwọn ilé iṣẹ́ tó ń fi ọjà/ẹrù ránṣẹ́ maha ń pa owó iyebíye láti fi nǹkan ránṣẹ́ ní kíakía. Lọ́pọ̀ ìgbà àsìkò ṣe pàtàkì púpọ̀ pẹ́lù àwọn ìwé ìdókowò, ọjà tàbí àwọn ẹ̀yà ara tí wọ́n fi tún nǹkan ṣe ní kíákíá. = English: Courier companies are well paid for delivering things quickly. Frequently, time is very important with business documents, merchandise or spare parts for an urgent repair. ### Yoruba: Dustin “Goldust” Runnels sọ wípé “Luna náà dá yàtọ̀ bí i tèmi...bóyá ó tilẹ̀ ju tèmi lọ...Mo fẹ́ràn rẹ̀ àti pé mà á sàárò rẹ̀...ìrètí wà wípé ó wà níbi tó dára.” = English:

column1: Yoruba: Wọ́n ní ẹsẹ̀ tó ní pele àti èékán, wọ́n ń yé ẹyin àti pé wọ́n ń rìn pẹ̀lú ẹsẹ̀ ẹ̀yìn wọn méjì bíi ti T-REX. = English: They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex. ### Yoruba: Kò sàgbékalẹ̀ iye kankan fún ègé náà, sọ pé wọ́n yíò se é ní ìbámu àbájáde ọrọ̀ ajé ilẹ̀ China. = English:

column1: Yoruba: Nígbàtí ó bá jẹ́ ẹrànko tí kìí ṣe ènìyàn lo tọ́ ọ, ọmọ-Feral a máa hu irúfẹ́ àwọn ìwà kan (tí ó jẹ́ mọ ìrínisí)ó fẹ́rẹ̀ jẹ́ pé bí gbogbo ìwà tí àwọn ẹranko náà ń hu ló ń hù, bí í bíbèrù ènìyàn tàbí kí wọ́n má bìkítà ènìyà. = English: When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans. ### Yoruba: Àwọn agbègbè tó tóbí nínu àríwá ní àwọn ènìyàn tó pọ̀ tí àwọn kan sí wà ní inú igbó tí kò ṣe gbé inú rẹ́. = English:
column2: Large areas further north are quite sparsely populated and some is nearly uninhabited wilderness.

column2: There are also a few buses going north to Hebron, the traditional burial place of the Biblical patriarchs Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and their wives.

They also provide shade. ### Yoruba: Nígbàtí ó bá jẹ́ ẹrànko tí kìí ṣe ènìyàn lo tọ́ ọ, ọmọ-Feral a máa hu irúfẹ́ àwọn ìwà kan (tí ó jẹ́ mọ ìrínisí)ó fẹ́rẹ̀ jẹ́ pé bí gbogbo ìwà tí àwọn ẹranko náà ń hu ló ń hù, bí í bíbèrù ènìyàn tàbí kí wọ́n má bìkítà ènìyà. = English:

column1: Yoruba: Akoko ti awon isele naa ti sele ni won maa n saba pe ni Akoko Aarin Giga, akoko ninu itan abalaye Yuropi ni senturi 11th, 12th ati 13th (AD 1000-1300). = English: The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). ### Yoruba: Bákanáà, se àrídájú pé o pe r ati rr lọ́tọ́ọ̀tọ̀: caro túmọ̀ sí ọ̀wọ́n nígbàtí carro túmọ̀ sí kẹ̀kẹ́ ẹṣin. = English:
column2: Also, make sure to pronounce r and rr differently: caro means dear, whereas carro means chariot.

column1: Yoruba: Ní ọdún 1994, ìjà yìí yọrí sí ìdásílẹ̀ ilẹ̀ olómìnira Transnistrialẹ́kùn gúúsù Moldova, èyí tó ní ìjọba tara rẹ̀ àti owó wọn, àmọ́ orílẹ̀ tó jẹ́ ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ àjọ UN. = English: In 1994, this conflict led to the creation of the self-proclaimed Transnistria Republic in eastern Moldova, which has its own government and currency but is not recognised by any UN member country. ### Yoruba: Aladari ijoba fi’di he Julia Gillard so nigba ipolongo eto idibo ijoba apapo odun 2010 wipe oun gbagbo pe Autralia yio ni ominira ni opin isejoba Oba’binrin Elizabeth II. = English:

column3: The Labor Party’s leader, Julia Gillard, was elected Prime Minister of Australia in 2010 after a campaign in which she claimed that Australia was a sovereign nation and not a colony of the British Queen.

column1: Yoruba: Ìwárí lórí íntánẹ̀ẹ́tì fún 'ẹ̀kọ́ agbègbè' ma pèsè àdírksì ilé iṣẹ́ agbègbè. = English: A search of the Internet for 'Hostile environment course' will probably provide the address of a local company. ### Yoruba: Cochamó Valley - Gbajúgbajà òkè ni Chile, tí a tún mọ̀ sí Yosemite ti Gúsù Amẹ́ríkà, pẹ̀lú onírúurú ògiri akọ òkúta àti òkúta sóńsó. = English:

column3: The Cochamó Valley is a famous mountain range in Chile, also known as the Yosemite of the South, with its rock walls and waterfalls.

column1: Yoruba: Amóò, àwọn ètò wọ̀nyí kúròláṣà mọ́jú nígbàtí bíi ajagun 800,000 láti Egbe Ajagun Pupa tì Ìgbìmọ̀ Sofieti wọlé, wọ́n díbọ́n Belarusi àti Yukireni léhin tí wọ́n ṣẹ́gun apá ila òórùn Polandi, ní ìlòdì sí Àdéhùn Àláfíà Riga, Àdéhùn Má-Jàkadì Sofieti-Polandi, pẹ̀lú gbogbo àwọn Àdéhùn ìlúsílù, àti t’oníìlú méjì ati t’oníìlú púpọ̀ si. = English: However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral. ### Yoruba: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ àwọn ọjà German ni almonds, lpà, àti àwọn ẹ̀pa orí igi wà nínú rẹ̀. Àwọn àkàrà òyìnbó tí a mọ̀ dáadáa ní a lè jẹ́ pẹ̀lú ife coffee. = English:

column1: Yoruba: Àwọn àpẹrẹ ni, ṣìṣètò àti ṣíṣe ìpínsípò, agbára láti dáhùn àwọn ìbéèrè oníbàára, bí dídá kíkọ ìwé mọ̀ , àti ohùn àti ojú. = English: Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. ### Yoruba: Ẹni tó sọ̀rọ̀ fún Búsì Godoni Johanudro pé ilérí Koria Ariwa ní “ìgbésẹ̀ nlá sọ́na àlébá láti yọ irin ogún nukilia kúrò ní irekusu Koria. = English:

column1: Yoruba: Awon ogbontarigi olorin kakiri orileede sagbekale bhajans abi orin isin si abe ese Shyam. = English: Famous singers across the country presented bhajans, or devotional songs, to Shri Shyam's feet. ### Yoruba: Ìlànà ìdáná àwọn Majorcan bí i ti àwọn tó wà ní agbègbè omi, ló dá lórí búrẹ́dì, ẹ̀fọ́ àti ẹran (pàápàá jùlọ ẹran ẹlẹ́dẹ̀), tí wọ́n si ma ń lo òróró ólìfù. = English:
column2: Majorcan cuisine, like that of similar zones in the Mediterranean, is based on bread, vegetables and meat (specially pork), and uses olive oil throughout.
column3: The Majorcan diet is based on bread, cheese and meat (especially goat meat), and they use olive oil as a condiment.

column1: Yoruba: O de si orile ede US, pelu senti 4, to je owo to ni laye lorun, pelu iwe ewi, pelu iwe akosile oniduro lati odo Charles Batchelor (oga re ni ise ti o se gbeyin) si Thomas Edison. = English: He arrived in the US with 4 cents to his name, a book of poetry, and a letter of recommendation from Charles Batchelor (his manager in his previous job) to Thomas Edison. ### Yoruba: Ninu iforoworo kan, o wi pe irufe titun naa o n “danilamu pupo o de n fa ijaya nitoripe osuwon iku ti o le sokun fa, o ga.” = English:

column1: Yoruba: O ṣeéṣe kí kọ́mẹ́tì jọ́nà tí omí ma ń fi dé ilé ayé pẹ̀lù nkan ọ̀gáníkì tó ní protini nínú tó ṣì n gbe èémí lẹ́yìn. = English: Comets may possibly have been a source of water delivery to the earth along with organic matter that can form proteins and support life. ### Yoruba: Nígbà tí ẹgbẹ́ kékeré nǹkan abẹ̀mí (tó kéré níye) bá yẹra kúrò lọ́dọ̀ àwọn olùgbé àkọ́kọ́ tíwọ́n ti wá (bí i kí wọ́n kúrò lórí òkè àbí odò tàbí tí wọ́n bá kó lọ sí erékùsù tuntun kí wọ́n má lè padà mọ́) wọ́n yíò ri wípé wọ́n bára wọn ní àyíká tó yàtọ̀ ju ibi tí wọ́n wà tẹ́lẹ̀ lọ. = English:

Under normal circumstances, travelling through multiple countries would mean having to go through visa applications and passport control multiple times. ### Yoruba: Àwọn èyàn ti mọ̀ nípa àwọn kemika pepe bí wúrà, fàdákà àti kọ́pa àtijọ́, torípé a lè rí wọn ní ìṣẹ̀dá ní ipò àdáyéba wọn, kò dẹ̀ le jù láti wú wọn jáda láti inú ilẹ̀ pẹ̀lú irinṣẹ́ àtilẹ̀bá. = English:

column1: Yoruba: Lílo ìtàkùn Blog ní ọ̀nà tí ó tọ́ “lè ró àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ní agbára láti di ẹni tó ń wo nǹkan ní àwòfín, tí yóò si lè ṣe ọ̀rínkíniwin rẹ̀; látàrí fífèsì tí ó tọ̀nà sí àwọn nǹkan tí ẹnìyàn ń rí lórí ayélujara, akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ lè sọ nípa ohun tí wọn rò ní pa elọmìíran tàbí sọ èròwọn nípa nǹkan kí nǹkan (Oravec, 2002). = English: Appropriate use of blogs "can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002). ### Yoruba: Èèyàn kan tò ń siṣẹ́ ní ibi ìgbọ́kọ̀sí tó súnmọ́ ibi tí ìjàm̀bá ti wáyé ní “Àwọn ọmọ́dé ń dúró láti ré kọjá ojú pópó àti pé wọ́n ń pariwo bẹ́ẹ̀sì ni wọ́n ń sọkún.” = English:

column1: Yoruba: Lọ́sẹ̀ tó kọjá, METI kéde pé iléeṣẹ́ Apple ti fi ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìgbónájù mẹ́rìnlélọ́gbọ̀n tó òhun léti, èyí tí iléeṣẹ́ pè ní “àìkójú-òsùwọ̀n.” = English: Last week, METI announced that Apple had informed it of 34 additional overheating incidents, which the company called "non-serious." ### Yoruba: Won ma n pe awon omo kan ni “odaju” tabi alaileko. column1: Yoruba: Fún àpẹrẹ, “Kíkọ́ ẹ́kọ́” àti “jíjáde” ní a mọ̀ sí ìwúrí tó ṣe pàtàki fún ìlò íńtánẹ́ẹ̀tì (James et al., 1995. = English: For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). ### Yoruba: Awọn ohun elo bii kasiọmu ati potasiọmu jẹ gẹgẹ bi irin, bẹẹ ni irin bii wura ati fadaka naa wa. = English:

column1: Yoruba: Lówùrọ́ọ̀ ọjọ́ ayé rẹ̀, ètò náà sàfihàn ìlò ìtàkùn rádíò TogiNet Radio, ìtàkùn tó fojúsun ọ̀rọ̀ orí rádíò. = English: In its early days, the show was featured solely at the long-running internet radio site TogiNet Radio, a site focused on talk radio. ### Yoruba: Nígbàtí Goma wà ní àbò, èyíkèyí àbẹ̀wò ní ìta Goma ní láti ní ìwádìí kíkún láti ní òye ìjà lemọ́lemọ́ ní agbègbè North Kivu. = English:

column1: Yoruba: Láti tubọ̀ ṣe àfihàn suńkẹrẹ-fàkẹrẹ, wọ́n ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ ìbáṣepọ̀ láàáriń (1) ìsàn (2) ìlóòrin (3) ìsáre. = English: To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. ### Yoruba: Akoko ti awon isele naa ti sele ni won maa n saba pe ni Akoko Aarin Giga, akoko ninu itan abalaye Yuropi ni senturi 11th, 12th ati 13th (AD 1000-1300). = English:
column2: The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300).

column1: Yoruba: Àwọn tí wọ́n fi ẹ̀sùn kan ní orúkọ wọ́n jẹ́ Baba Kanjar, Bhutha Kanjar, Rampro Kanjar, Gaza Kanjar àti Vishnu Kanjar. = English: The accused are named as Baba Kanjar, Bhutha Kanjar, Rampro Kanjar, Gaza Kanjar and Vishnu Kanjar. ### Yoruba: Bí ó tilẹ̀jẹ́ wípé ìlú kọ̀kan jẹ́ ará 'Scandinavian', ìyàtọ̀ púpọ̀ wà láàrín àwọn èèyàn, ọba, àṣà,ìṣe àti ìtàn àwn ìlú Denmark, Sweden, Norway àti Iceland. = English:
column2: Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.
column3: Although the Scandinavian countries are all of the same origin, there are many differences between the people, kings, customs, traditions and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.

column1: Yoruba: Ní oṣù tó kọjá, ìgbìmọ̀ àrẹ kan filọ̀ pe kí CEP tó wà nípò tẹ́lẹ̀, fi iṣẹ́ lẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ara àwọn igbese láti mú kí ilu ṣe ìbò titun. = English: Last month a presidential commission recommended the prior CEP's resignation as part of a package of measures to move the country towards new elections. ### Yoruba: Jiankalo Fisisela o lè ṣàkóso moto mọ́,ó dẹ̀ mú u kí èrè sísá náà parí lẹ́sẹ̀kẹsẹ̀ tí wọ́n bẹ̀rẹ̀. = English:

column3: The fire brigade can put out a fire, but it will not make the fireworks end immediately, as they started.

column1: Yoruba: Àwọn òkè ilẹ̀ Peninsula ti darapọ̀ di to ní ìpele, ó tún wá parapọ̀ di òkè alásopọ̀ ti oníkìlómítà ọ̀tàlélọ́dọ̀ọ́rún ti àwọn òkè Elisworth, èyí tí Minnesota Glacier pín sí méjì. = English: The mountains of the Peninsula here merge into the plateau, then re-emerge to form the 360 km chain of the Ellsworth Mountains, bisected by the Minnesota Glacier. ### Yoruba: Bí a ti ṣe mọ ìlú Paris gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìlú tó ma ń ṣàralóge ní àgbáyé, A mọ Constantinople gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìlú aṣaralógé tí feudal Europe. = English:

column1: Yoruba: Nínu archipelagos àti lakes, o kò fi taratara nílò yacht. = English: In the archipelagos and lakes you do not necessarily need a yacht. ### Yoruba: Oúnjẹ alẹ́ tí ó gbajúgbajà pàápàá jùlọ ní àkókò yìí ni Pa amb Oil: búrẹ́dì pẹ̀lú olive oil, tòmátì, ati èyíkéyì ohun tí ẹnu ń jẹ́ bí i wàrà, ẹja tuna abbl. = English:

column1: Yoruba: Ọba búburú Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette àwọn ọmọ wọn kékèké méjì ( Marie Therese, ọmọ ọdún mọ́kànlá àti Louis-Charles ọmọ ọdún mẹ́rin) àti àbúrò ọba obìnrin Madam Elizabeth, ní ọjọ́ kẹfà, oṣù kẹwa ọdún 1789, ni ọ̀gọọrọ̀ àwọn ìyá ọlọ́jà lé jáde pada sí Paris láti Versailles. = English: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. ### Yoruba: Ìrìnàjò afẹ́ a-jẹmọ́-ìdẹ́dàá máa ń mú kí ìfẹ́ àwọn ènìyàn sí lílọ sí àwọn ibí tí ìṣẹ̀dá pọ̀si wà, kí wọ́n le gbádùn afẹ́fẹ́, ìpalọ́lọ́ to fi mọ́ ewékò àti àwọn ẹrànko ìgbẹ. = English:

column2: By 1976, thirty percent of Machu Picchu had been restored and restoration continues till today.
column3: In 1976, the Inca citadel of Machu Picchu was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site and has continued to be so to this day.

column1: Yoruba: Àwọn ìjọba ti ṣe lérí pé ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ abẹ́rẹ́ àjẹsára encephalitis, èyí tó ma rànwálọ́wọ́ láti gbáradì fún àwọn àjọ ìlera fún ọdún tó ń bọ̀. = English: Several million vials of encephalitis vaccine have also been promised by the government, which will help prepare health agencies for next year. ### Yoruba: Tó bá jẹ́ wípé o ti pè fún ìwé ìrìnnà ojú òfúrufú àti iléègbé fọ́dún 2020 kí wọ́n tó kéde ìsúnsíwájú, o lè wà nípò ẹ̀tàn. = English:
column2: If you booked your flights and accommodation for 2020 before the postponement was announced, you may have a tricky situation.

column1: Yoruba: Ní ìtọ́wò PALM ZMapp jẹ́ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìṣàkóso o túmọ̀ si wípé àwọn onímọ̀ sayensi fi ṣe gbendeke wọ́n dẹ̀ fi wé àwọn ogun mẹ́ta ìyóku. = English: In the PALM trial, ZMapp served as a control, meaning scientists used it as a baseline and compared the three other treatments to it. ### Yoruba: Ìjábọ̀ náà jẹ́ ǹkan tó le gan ní gbogbo ẹ̀yà ìlànà tuntun ti àwọn adarí sí ìlú Iraq ó sì sọ pé kí wọ́n yí ọ̀nà padà. = English:
column2: The Report is highly critical of almost every aspect of the present policy of the Executive towards Iraq and it urges an immediate change of direction.
column3: The report was a major blow to the new Iraqi leadership, which had been trying to change the way things were done.

column1: Yoruba: Lónìí ìlú òtòṣì ní Timbuktu, ṣùgbọ́n ó lorúkọ gẹ́gẹ́ bí ibi tó ma n fẹjúmọ́ àwọn onirinajo, ó sì ní pápá ọkọ̀ òfurufú. = English: Today, Timbuktu is an impoverished town, although its reputation makes it a tourist attraction, and it has an airport. ### Yoruba: Ilẹ̀ Japan ní erékùsù tó tó ẹgbẹ̀rún méje (èyí tó tóbi jù ní Honshu), sọ ilẹ̀ Japan di erékùsù tó tóbi jù sìkeje ní àgbáyé! = English:
column2: Japans holds nearly 7,000 islands (the biggest being Honshu), making Japan the 7th largest island in the world!
column3: Japan has the world's largest number of islands (over 7,000), making it the world's largest island country!

column1: Yoruba: Edgar Veguilla gba ọgbẹ́ ní apá ati àgbọ̀ǹ nígbà tí Kristoffer Scheider wà ní ipò tó nílò àtúnsẹ isé abẹ fún ojú rè. = English: Edgar Veguilla received arm and jaw wounds while Kristoffer Schneider was left requiring reconstructive surgery for his face. ### Yoruba: Arísítótù, fìlọ́sọ́fà, dárò pé ẹ̀kun gbogbo nkan láyé yìí ni ìkan tàbí ọ̀pọ̀ nínu àwọn nkan ohun èlò mẹ́rin. Àwọn ni ilẹ̀, omi, afẹ́fẹ́, iná. = English:
column2: Aristotle, a philosopher, theorised that everything is made up of a mixture of one or more of four elements. They were earth, water, air, and fire.
column3: Archimedes, the Greek mathematician, once said that the whole of the universe is made up of the four elements – earth, water, air and fire.

column1: Yoruba: Ní kẹ́tẹ́ ti o ba ti kúrò nínú ìjì, wíwẹ odò padà kí jé ìnira mo lọ̀pọ́ ìgbà. = English: As soon as you get out of the current, swimming back is no more difficult than normally. ### Yoruba: Àwọn átọ̀mùn ní núkíléì tí kò mára dúró èyí tó túmọ̀ sí wípé wọ́n lè kán tí nǹkan kékeré bá kàn wọ́n tàbí tí ohunkóhun kò bá kàn wọ́n. = English:
column2: Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.
column3: The ants are not afraid of anything, which means that they can be hit by anything or anything can hit them.

column1: Yoruba: MS je aarun ti o ma n se akoba fun aringbungbun eto ainifokanbale ti o niise pelu opolo, ogoro eyin ati opa ofoolo. = English: MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. ### Yoruba: Ní ìparí 2015, Togineti dá Rédíò Astroneti sílẹ̀ gẹ́gẹ́ bí àyè rédíò àbẹ́. = English:
column2: In late 2015, TogiNet established AstroNet Radio as a subsidiary station.
column3: In 2015, Togineti launched the Satellite Radio as a radio station.

column1: Yoruba: Àwọn ajalèlókun ló jàálólè, wọ́n jalè ní Tibet nípa lílo ajá elégbọn, ó sá kúrò nínu ìgbáyàwó rẹ wọ́n sì mu ní India. = English: He was robbed by pirates, attacked in Tibet by a rabid dog, escaped marriage in Nepal and was arrested in India. ### Yoruba: Bí yíó ba fi di ọjọ́ kẹtàdínlógún oṣù kẹsàn án, 1993, ikọ̀ alábòbò ilẹ̀ Poland àti ìrètí tó wà ni láti sàtúnse ìpàgọ́ àti àtúngbékalẹ̀ pẹ̀lú ilẹ̀ Ròòmù. = English:
column2: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead.
column3: If it is the 17th of the 7th month of 1993, the Polish army and the hope of the world to conquer and occupy Rome.

column1: Yoruba: Àwọn ara ìlú Portugali parun wọn si tún sẹ àtúnkọ́ rè pélù orúkọ Casa Brance, kó tó di pé wọn tún sẹ àtúnkọ lẹ́yìn ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ ìwárìrì-ilè ní 1755. = English: The Portuguese destroyed it and rebuilt it under the name Casa Branca, only to abandon it after an earthquake in 1755. ### Yoruba: A ti rí ṣálángá tó ṣẹkù nínú àwọn ilé ní agbègbè Minoan ti Crete àti Santorini ní Greece. = English:
column2: Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece.
column3: We have found a shingle roof in the Minoan houses of Crete and Santorini in Greece.

column1: Yoruba: Láti ìgbà tí ìjọba àpapọ̀ ti gba ìsúná ilé ìwòsàn Mersey tí ó wà ní Devonport, ní Tasmania, ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ àti àwọn Aṣojú ìjọbá àpapọ̀ ti bu ẹnu àtẹ́ lu ìgbésẹ̀ yìí gẹ́gẹ́ bí ètè tí ó ní í ṣe pẹlú ètò ìdìbò tó ń bọ̀ ní oṣù kọkànlá. = English: Ever since the Federal Government stepped in to take over funding of the Mersey hospital in Devonport, Tasmania, the state government and some federal MPs have criticised this act as a stunt in the prelude to the federal election to be called by November. ### Yoruba: Irekusu Hon Kongi fun agbegbe Hon Kongi ni oruko re o de je ibi ti abewo pupo ma n dojuko ju. = English:
column2: Hong Kong Island gives the territory of Hong Kong its name and is the place that many tourists regard as the main focus.
column3: The Hong Kong International Airport is the busiest airport in the world.

column1: Yoruba: Ní gbogbo apa irekusu naa, wọ́n ma n gba Pọ́n ìlú Ọba pẹ̀lú ní ibi tí káàdì àwìn àti Dola Ìlú Amerika. = English: British pounds will generally be accepted anywhere in the islands and within Stanley credit cards and United States dollars are also often accepted. ### Yoruba: Lákòókò ìgbà ogun líle tó wáyé láàrin àwọn ọlọ́lá tó ń jà fún ipò. = English:
column2: During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne.

column1: Yoruba: Irekusu Hon Kongi fun agbegbe Hon Kongi ni oruko re o de je ibi ti abewo pupo ma n dojuko ju. = English: Hong Kong Island gives the territory of Hong Kong its name and is the place that many tourists regard as the main focus. ### Yoruba: Àwọn asètò àlááfíà àjọ UN, tí wọ́n dé ìlú Haiti lẹ́yìn ìsẹ̀lẹ̀ ìjì líle ní ọdún 2010, ni wọ́n ti dá lẹ́bi fún títan ààrùn tó bẹ̀rẹ̀ ní etí bèbè àgọ́ àwọn ọmọ ológun ká. = English:
column2: UN peacekeepers, whom arrived in Haiti after the 2010 earthquake, are being blamed for the spread of the disease which started near the troop's encampment.
column3: The United Nations peacekeeping force that arrived in Haiti after the 2010 earthquake is accused of spreading the disease that began in the barracks of the army.

column1: Yoruba: UN tún ní ìrètí láti parí ìkówójọ láti ran àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè tó ní ìkọlù global warming lọ́wọ́. = English: The U.N. also hopes to finalize a fund to help countries affected by global warming to cope with the impacts. ### Yoruba: Wàhálà bird flu sí àwa ènìyàn, H5N1, ti gba àrídájú pé o ti koran pẹ́pẹ́yẹ, tí wọ́n rí ní ọjọ́ ajé, ní marshland ní tò sí Lyon ní ìlà òòrùn France. = English:
column2: The strain of bird flu lethal to humans, H5N1, has been confirmed to have infected a dead wild duck, found on Monday, in marshland near Lyon in the east of France.
column3: The bird flu outbreak, H5N1, has been confirmed in a dead bird found in a marshland in Lyon, France, on the day before yesterday.

column1: Yoruba: Tí o bá lọ sí ilẹ̀ òkèrè fún ìgbà àkọ́kọ́, àwọn ènìyàn lè ṣe sùúrù pẹ̀lú ẹ, nítorí wọn mọ̀ pé àwọn arìnrìnàjò ní orílẹ̀ èdè tuntun nílò láti farasinl. = English: When you went abroad at first, people were probably patient and understanding, knowing that travellers in a new country need to adapt. ### Yoruba: Ní àwọn òpópónà kan, àwọn ilé iṣẹ́ ńlánlá ní ọkọ̀ ojú òfurufú wọn, ṣùgbọ́n ní àwọn òpópónà míràn àti ní àwọn ilé iṣẹ́ kékèké, wàhálà wà. = English:
column2: On some routes, the larger companies have their own planes, but for other routes and smaller firms there was a problem.
column3: In some places, major companies have their own planes, but in other places and smaller companies, there is a lot of hassle.

column1: Yoruba: Àwọn “ikọ̀ àìrí” ni wọ́n ń se ìsàkóso ikọ̀ èyí táwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ jábọ̀ fún. Ikọ̀ àìrí ti se ágbékalẹ̀ ìlànà fáwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́. = English: The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member. ### Yoruba: Ìbáṣepsọ̀ ní ibi iṣẹ́ ṣe pàtàkì, títẹnumọ́ àkitiyan ẹgbẹ́ ju kí wọ́n ma gboríyín ǹkan tí oníkálùkù ti gbé ṣe. = English:
column2: Workplace harmony is crucial, emphasizing group effort rather than praising individual accomplishments.
column3: Teamwork is important at work, it is more important to acknowledge the efforts of each member than to boast about what each has done.

column1: Yoruba: Ni 2002 Goma parun nitori lafa folkeno Nyiragongo tó ri púpọ̀ nínu títí ìlú pàpà jùlọ ilé ìjọ-ìlú. = English: In 2002 Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano which buried most of the town’s streets, particularly the town centre. ### Yoruba: Ohun gbogbo tí mo má ń sọ fáwọn ènìyàn ni wípé kí o tọ́jú wa bí a se ń tọ́jú rẹ. = English:
column2: All I say to people is you treat us the way we treat you.
column3: All I can say to people is that you take care of us as we take care of you.

column1: Yoruba: Ìdide ọgbọ́n àmúṣe fún wa ni àǹfààní láti rí, kí a sì ṣe ìwádìí ipo ọpọlọ àti ìgbéṣẹ̀ tí a kò rí rí. = English: The rise of new technologies allows us to see and investigate brain structures and processes never seen before. ### Yoruba: Lílo ìtàkùn Blog ní ọ̀nà tí ó tọ́ “lè ró àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ní agbára láti di ẹni tó ń wo nǹkan ní àwòfín, tí yóò si lè ṣe ọ̀rínkíniwin rẹ̀; látàrí fífèsì tí ó tọ̀nà sí àwọn nǹkan tí ẹnìyàn ń rí lórí ayélujara, akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ lè sọ nípa ohun tí wọn rò ní pa elọmìíran tàbí sọ èròwọn nípa nǹkan kí nǹkan (Oravec, 2002). = English:
column2: Appropriate use of blogs "can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002).
column3: Using blogs is a good way to “teach students how to read and write for the web, and to help them develop their critical thinking skills.” (Oravec, 2002).

column1: Yoruba: Wọn ti ọpọpọna ti ijamba naa ti ṣẹlẹ ni titipa fun gba diẹ nigbati awọn oṣiṣẹ pajawiri gbiyanju lati yọ awakọ naa kuro ninu ọkọ Audi TT pupa. = English: The road where the crash happened was temporarily closed while emergency services freed the driver from the red Audi TT. ### Yoruba: Ní gbogbo apa irekusu naa, wọ́n ma n gba Pọ́n ìlú Ọba pẹ̀lú ní ibi tí káàdì àwìn àti Dola Ìlú Amerika. = English:

column1: Yoruba: Nítorínà ẹ̀yà ẹja méjì tí di ohun ìgbàgbé,bẹ́ẹ̀ àwọn méjì míràn wà nínú ewu, pẹ̀lú èyí tó suké. = English: As a result, two fish species have become extinct, and two others have become endangered, including the humpback chub. ### Yoruba: Fun awon Springbooki, o so ipadanu ere-marun seyin dopin. = English:
column2: For the Springboks, it ended a five-match losing streak.
column3: For the Springbok, the end of the rainy season is a time of great stress.

column1: Yoruba: Montevideo wà ní ilé olóoru; ní àwọn oṣù àkókò eèrùn, ìwọ̀n ooru tó má ń wọ́pọ̀ ni èyí tó ma ń ju +30°C lọ. = English: Montevideo is in the subtropics; in the summer months, temperatures above +30°C are common. ### Yoruba: Ẹkun ti Chaco jẹ ile fun ọpọlọpọ ẹgbẹ awọn ẹya abinibi bi Guaycurú ati Payaguá, ti o jẹ iṣẹ ọdẹ ṣiṣe ati ẹja pipa ni won yan laayo. = English:
column2: The Chaco region was home to other groups of indigenous tribes such as the Guaycurú and Payaguá, who survived by hunting, gathering and fishing.
column3: The Chaco is a land of many indigenous peoples, such as the Guaycurú and Payaguá, who are hunters and gatherers.

column1: Yoruba: Àwọn ẹ̀gbẹ́ Omi Ọ̀nà Tamaku wà ní Pápá Ọkọ̀ Ojú Omi Waitemata Harbour, ní òkéọjà àti agbègbè Mission Bay àti St Heliers ní àringbùngbùn Auckland. = English: Tamaki Drive beaches are on the Waitemata Harbour, in the upmarket suburbs of Mission Bay and St Heliers in Central Auckland. ### Yoruba: Ìriìn àjò nínú ọkọ̀ òfuruufú lẹ jẹ ìrírí ìjayà fún èyàn lóórẹkóórẹ, pàápàá júlọ tó bá jẹ pé wọn kò tìí fò télè tàbí wọn ti ní ìrírí tó banilérù. = English:
column2: Travelling by plane can be a scary experience for people of all ages and backgrounds, particularly if they've not flown before or have experienced a traumatic event.
column3: Flying is a thrill for the young and old alike, especially for those who have never flown before or have not flown for a long time.

column1: Yoruba: Láìpẹ́, léyìn egberun tàbi mílíọ́nù ọdún, iye àwọn èèyàn náà ò ní jọra tó jẹ́ pé a ò lè pe wọ́n ní ęgbẹ́ alàyè kán náà. = English: Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. ### Yoruba: Ọ̀kan lára òpó ẹ̀sìn kìrìsìtíẹ́nì ni pé, ọrọ̀ gbọ́dọ̀ jẹ́ lílò láti fi mún ìyà àti ìṣẹ́ tán nílẹ̀ àti wípé àwọn owó ìjọ wà fún ìdí pàtàki náà. = English:
column2: One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason.
column3: One of the tenets of Christianity is that charity should be used to alleviate poverty and suffering in the world, and that church funds should be used for that purpose.

column1: Yoruba: Egberun odun seyin, okunrin ti a n pe ni Aristakusu wipe Ona Orun man yi orun ka. = English: Thousands of years ago, a man called Aristarchus said that the Solar System moved around the Sun. ### Yoruba: Awon asa ati eya atijo bere si ni pa won mo lati le ri miliki, irun eran ati awo ara lo ni irorun. = English:
column2: Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins.
column3: The world and the people and the animals were created to be able to see, to have hair and to have eyes.

column1: Yoruba: Nínu archipelagos àti lakes, o kò fi taratara nílò yacht. = English: In the archipelagos and lakes you do not necessarily need a yacht. ### Yoruba: Ọkùnrin afọ́jú a gùnkè ilẹ̀ Poland Maciej Krezel àti guide Anna Ogarzynska parí pẹ̀lú ipò kẹtàlá nínú ìdíje Super-G. Jong Seork Park ti ilẹ̀ South Korea parí pẹ̀lú ipò mẹ́rìnlélógún nígun àwọn ọkùnrin super-G. = English:
column2: Poland's men's visually impaired skier Maciej Krezel and guide Anna Ogarzynska finished thirteenth in the Super-G. South Korea's Jong Seork Park finished twenty-fourth in the men's sitting Super-G.
column3: The blind man, Maciej Krezel, and guide Anna Ogarzynska finished third in the Super-G race. Jong Seork Park of South Korea finished in the 20th place in the men's super-G race.

column1: Yoruba: Àwọn ilé ìwé mẹ́rìnlà ní Hawaii tó wà ní tàbí tó wà ní ẹ̀gbẹ́ etí òkun ti jẹ́ títìpa ní ọjọ́rú pẹ̀lú bí wọ́n ṣe yọ ìkìlọ̀ kúrò. = English: Fourteen schools in Hawaii located on or near coastlines were closed all of Wednesday despite the warnings being lifted. ### Yoruba: Bí nọ́ḿbà Rossby bá se kéré tó, bẹ́ẹ̀ náà ni iye ìràwọ̀ kò se ní lágbára sí ní ìtọ́ka sí ìdápadà sẹ́yìn agbérin. = English:
column2: The smaller the Rossby number, the less active the star with respect to magnetic reversals.
column3: The Rossby number is the ratio of the advection time scale to the rotation time scale. If the Rossby number is small, the advection time scale is much larger than the rotation time scale, and the advection of the vorticity by the flow is much more important than the advection of the flow by the vorticity.

column1: Yoruba: Kí àwọn ológun tó dé, ìlú Haiti kò ì tí kojú ìsòro tí ó jọ́ mọ́ ààrùn yìí láti ọdun 1800. = English: Prior to the arrival of troops, Haiti had not encountered problems related to the disease since the 1800s. ### Yoruba: Bákanáà, nípa níní ìwé ìrìnnà Schengen , o kò nílò láti bèèrè fún ìwé ìrìnnà lọ sí àwọn orílẹ̀èdè tó jẹ́ ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ Schengen lọ́ọ̀tọtọ̀, nítorínà, wàá lè pa àkókò, owó àti àwọn àkójọ ìwé mọ́. = English:
