column1: Yoruba: Àwọn ohun tó kọjá ayé yìí jẹ Muhammad lógún. Ó má ń lọ síbi ihò kan tí ó di ohun tí wọ́n mọ̀ sí “iHira” lórí òkè “Noor” (ìmọ́lẹ̀) fún àsàrò. = English: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. ### Yoruba: O je ibanuje pe ona titun lati fikowe ti jade, pensu ti jabo si ipo kekere ati ilo kekere. = English:
column2: Sadly, as newer methods of writing have emerged, the pencil has been relegated to lesser status and uses.
column3: He was a man of great vision who saw the need to free the mind from the shackles of tradition, to break the chains of oppression and to establish a just society.

column1: Yoruba: Singapore jẹ́ ibi tó ní àbò jùlọ láti wà ó sì rọrùn láti lọ kiri, o sì lè ra gbogbo ǹkan tí o bá dé ibẹ̀. = English: Singapore is generally an extremely safe place to be and very easy to navigate, and you can buy almost anything after arriving. ### Yoruba: Àwọn oìwoye tí wọ́n gbà lórí ìmọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ sáyẹ̀nsì àti ìmọ̀ ọpọlọ ni ìwòye Aristotle. = English:
column2: Accepted were Aristotle's views on all matters of science, including psychology.
column3: The most important contributions to science and philosophy were made by Aristotle.

column1: Yoruba: Ọlọ́pàá Filipino ní ìgbà kan rí ti fi àwọn arìnrìnàjò afẹ́ láti Hong Kong sí àhámọ́ nípa fífi agídí gba ọkọ̀ bọ́ọ̀sì wọn lọ́wọ́ wọn ni Manila, tí ó jẹ́ olú ìlú Philippines. = English: A former Filipino policeman has kept Hong Kong tourists hostage by hijacking their bus in Manila, the capital of the Philippines. ### Yoruba: Tiọ́rì àkóónú dá lórí ìwádí ohun tí ó mú àwọn èèyàn yigbì tàbí dùnmọ́ wọn. = English:
column2: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them.
column3: The focus of this article is on the reasons why people are angry or upset.

column1: Yoruba: Àwọn “ikọ̀ àìrí” ni wọ́n ń se ìsàkóso ikọ̀ èyí táwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ jábọ̀ fún. Ikọ̀ àìrí ti se ágbékalẹ̀ ìlànà fáwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́. = English: The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member. ### Yoruba: A kọ́ àwọn ilé wa pẹ̀lú ewé a sì ṣe àwọn aṣọ wá nínu ewé náà. Púpọ̀ nínú àwọn óúnjẹ́ tí à ń jẹ jẹ́ ewé. Láìsí ewé, àwọn ẹranko kò lè yè. = English:
column2: We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.
column3: We built our houses with trees and we made our clothes from the trees. Most of the food we eat is from the trees. Without trees, animals cannot live.

column1: Yoruba: Látẹ̀yìnwá, Simpsons Simon ti sisẹ́ lórí ọ́pọ́lọpọ́ àwọn àfihàn ní onírúurú ipò. = English: Before The Simpsons Simon had worked on several shows in various positions. ### Yoruba: ifesewonse asekagba eto yio waye ni Papa isere Ellis ni Ilu johannesburg ni ose tin b, nigba ti Springboks gba pelu Australi. = English:
column2: The final match of the series will take place at Ellis Park in Johannesburg next week, when the Springboks play Australia.
column3: The first test match played at Ellis Park in Johannesburg on the 3rd of June, when Springboks beat Australia.

column1: Yoruba: Ìlú náà ló tún jẹ́ ibùdó fún gígun ilẹ̀ ríru Nyiragongo pẹ̀lú ìtọpa Oríòkè Gorilla tó dínwó jùlọ nílẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀. = English: The city is also the base to climb the Nyiragongo volcano along with some of the cheapest Mountain Gorilla tracking in Africa. ### Yoruba: Ìkan lára awọn ìlànà tí a n lò láti fi júwe bí ìdarapọ̀ ṣe ṣe pàtàkì ni kí a fi àpẹrẹ àwọn ọmọ tí ò kópa nínú ìdarapọ̀ mó èyàn nígbàtí wọ́n dàgbà nítorí àidásí, oríburúkú àti iṣilò. = English:
column2: One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up.
column3: One of the principles we use to judge the importance of integration is to see how many children of immigrants are born in the host country. If they are born in the host country, they are more likely to be integrated.

column1: Yoruba: Igbejade iwadi kan ni Ojobo ninu iwe iroyin imo ijinle jabo lori iparapo eya eye tuntun kan lori erekusu Ecuadorean Galapagos. = English: A study published on Thursday in the journal Science reported on formation of a new bird species on the Ecuadorean Galápagos Islands. ### Yoruba: Owó náà lè jẹ́ fún kíkọ́ ilé tágbàrá kò le wọ̀, tí yíò le sàkóso omi dáadáa òhun dídari ohun ọ̀gbìn. = English:
column2: The money could go toward flood-proof houses, better water management, and crop diversification.
column3: The money can be used to build a greenhouse that will control the water well, and that will grow the plants.

column1: Yoruba: Ero ibanisoro oni satelaiti ko wa lati dipo ero ibanisoro adagbe nigbagbogbo, nitori pe o ni lati wa nita gbangba koo de ma foju ri satelaiti bayi, ki o to le fi pe. = English: A satellite phone is not generally a replacement for a mobile phone, as you have to be outdoors with clear line of sight to the satellite to make a phone call. ### Yoruba: Ilé ìfowópamọ́sí tó wà ní erékùsù ní Stanley káàkiri ibi ìtajà ìwọ̀ oòrùn FIC nìkan ni o ti lè pààrọ̀ owó. = English:
column2: Money can be exchanged at the only bank in the islands which is located in Stanley across from the FIC West store.
column3: The only bank in Stanley, the capital of the island of FIC, is the only one that can exchange money.

column1: Yoruba: Àwọn olóńgbò jẹranjẹran féràn láti ma jẹ ẹranko kekeke. Wọn a mú àwọn ọ̀bọ, ejò, ẹ̀kútẹ́ àti ẹyẹ tí ọwọ́ wọn bá tẹ̀. Bí i gbogbo ẹranko ti olóńgbo jẹranjẹran fi n ṣe ọdẹ rẹ ni o kẹ́rẹ́ juu lọ. = English: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. ### Yoruba: Máṣe bá ojú òpó náà jẹ́ nípa ṣíṣà mí si tàbí àwòrán tó wà ní ogiri. = English:
column2: Do not deface the site by marking or scratching graffiti into structures.
column3: Do not look through the window or at the picture on the wall.
